content.raw: We can make it different according to how deep they are in the tree. But it wouldn't be a difference between MODELS and LINKS, since we can have nested models in the same level as links. Does that make sense?
content.html: We can make it different according to how deep they are in the tree. But it wouldn't be a difference between MODELS and LINKS, since we can have nested models in the same level as links. Does that make sense?

content.raw: I just noticed that the Joints and Links headers have the same visual treatment as Models, which is the primary header for the tab. Since Joints and Links are not on the same level as Models, those headers should probably be a little less emphasized. Is the font size different for the headers vs. the main text?
content.html: I just noticed that the Joints and Links headers have the same visual treatment as Models, which is the primary header for the tab. Since Joints and Links are not on the same level as Models, those headers should probably be a little less emphasized. Is the font size different for the headers vs. the main text?

content.raw:
messages like these?

~~~
 [Wrn] [IntrospectionManager.cc:105] Item [data://world/default/model/ground_plane/link/link?p=pose/world_pose] already registered
~~~

I think we should be able to remove most of these by unregistering the introspection items in `Fini` or `destructor` of entities
content.html:
messages like these?

 [Wrn] [IntrospectionManager.cc:105] Item [data://world/default/model/ground_plane/link/link?p=pose/world_pose] already registered

I think we should be able to remove most of these by unregistering the introspection items in Fini or destructor of entities
